meanings.definition: The state or quality of being expected.
meanings.sent1: The expectednesses of the outcome put everyone at ease.
meanings.sent2: The expectednesses of his arrival made planning the surprise party difficult.
meanings.sent3: The expectednesses of the cat chasing its own tail never fails to amuse me.
meanings.sent4: The expectednesses of the sun rising every morning is a comforting constant in life.
meanings.sent5: The expectednesses of the train arriving on time is crucial for my daily commute.

meanings.definition: The likelihood of something happening or being true.
meanings.sent1: The expectednesses of rain in the forecast made her bring an umbrella.
meanings.sent2: The expectednesses of winning the lottery are very low.
meanings.sent3: The expectednesses of a penguin flying are quite amusing to think about.
meanings.sent4: The expectednesses of a volcano erupting can be both terrifying and fascinating.
meanings.sent5: The expectednesses of a baby's first steps are always a joyous occasion.
